Note: N.B. The Kav. form, with irregular reflex, may be a loan.
this form would indicate that *r > War. y and not Ø

N.B. A single protoform, which would satisfy all languages, is difficult to set up. Van Wynen's Tak. and Armentia's Tak. are not at all in agreement. There is no evidence that *r would give Ese. h. All sets of demonstratives in Takanan present extreme difficulty in reconstruction, and we must assume either that Takanan demonstratives evolved in highly erratic and individual ways or that a number of protomorphemes may be involved, some of which at least superficially resembled each other.
Armentia's forms: <ihe> 'este', <ihesa> 'de este', <ihesinecua> 'esta tarde', <iheve> 'este no más', all of which point to a <iʔe->, but also <ieichu> 'recién'
